name: My Favorite Chicken and Wild Rice Soup
author: Mel
summary: This is my favorite chicken and wild rice soup. It is a basic recipe and you can customize it to your taste easily. I like the flavor from the wild rice seasoning.
ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) package long grain and wild rice mix (such as Uncle Ben's ® Original)
directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat; add the chicken, whole carrots, celery, and whole onion
Cook until the chicken is browned, about 10 minutes
Stir in the crushed garlic cloves, and cook until soft, about 1 to 2 minutes
Pour enough water into the pot to cover the chicken and vegetables
While the soup is simmering, cook the rice according to package instructions
Removed cooked chicken from the pot to cool
Strain the broth, discarding cooked vegetables
Shred chicken and return to the pot along with the broth; stir in chopped carrots and lemon juice
Bring soup to a simmer, and cook until the carrots are soft, about 10 minutes
Stir in the cooked rice and chopped parsley
Season with additional salt and pepper, if needed
